pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.1.2: At that time a government official who was going away sent a message to the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.1.3: “Come, Venerables, I wish to give a robe to those who have spent the rainy-season residence.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.1.5: “The Master has allowed such robes only for those who have completed the rainy-season residence,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.1.6: and being afraid of wrongdoing they did not go.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.1.7: That government official complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.1.8: “How can you not come when I send a message?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.1.9: I’m going out with the army.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.1.10: It’s hard to know whether I will live or die.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.1.11: The monks heard the complaints of that government official,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.1.13: Soon afterwards the Master gave a teaching and addressed the monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.1.14: “Monks, I allow you to receive haste-cloth, and then store it.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.1: Knowing that the Master had made this allowance,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.4: and stored them beyond the robe season, in bundles on a bamboo robe-rack.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.5: While walking about the dwellings, Venerable Ānanda saw that cloth, and he asked the monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.10: and Ānanda then complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.11: “How can these monks receive haste-cloth and then store it beyond the robe season?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.12: After criticizing those monks in many ways, Ānanda told the Master. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.13: “Is it true, monks, that some monks do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.16: Monks, how can those foolish men receive haste-cloth and then store it beyond the robe season?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.17: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.18: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.19: ‘When there are ten days left to the Kattika full moon that ends the first rains residence and haste-cloth is given to a monk, he may receive it if he regards it as urgent. He may then store it until the end of the robe season.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:1.2.21: If he stores it beyond that, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.2: the invitation ceremony is ten days in the future.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.3: The Kattika full moon that ends the first rains residence:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.4: the Kattika full moon of the invitation ceremony is what is meant.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.6: when someone wants to go out with the army, when someone wants to go away, when someone is sick, when someone is pregnant, when someone without faith acquires faith, when someone without confidence acquires confidence— if that person sends a message to the monks, saying, “Come, Venerables, I wish to give a robe to those who have spent the rains-residence residence,” this is called “haste-cloth.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.10: He may receive it if he regards it as urgent. He may then store it until the end of the robe season:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.12: establishing the perception of it as a haste-cloth, he may store it.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.14: for one who has not done the robe-making ceremony, it is the last month of the rainy season;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.15: for one who has done the robe-making ceremony, it is the five month period.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.16: If he stores it beyond that:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.17: for one who has not done the robe-making ceremony, if he goes beyond the last day of the rainy season, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.18: For one who has done the robe-making ceremony, if he goes beyond the day on which the robe-making season ends, the cloth becomes subject to relinquishment.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.19: The cloth should be relinquished to an Order, a group, or an individual.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.20: “And, monks, it should be relinquished in this way.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.21: To be expanded as in [Relinquishment 1, paragraphs 13–17](pli-tv-bu-vb-np1#13), with appropriate substitutions.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.22: ‘Venerables, this haste-cloth which I have kept beyond the robe season is to be relinquished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.23: I relinquish it to the Order.’ …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.26: ‘I give this cloth back to you.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.27: If it is haste-cloth and he perceives it as haste-cloth, and he keeps it beyond the robe season, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.28: If it is haste-cloth, but he is unsure if it is, and he keeps it beyond the robe season, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.29: If it is haste-cloth, but he does not perceives it as haste-cloth, and he keeps it beyond the robe season, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.30: If it has not been determined, but he perceives it as determined …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.31: If it has not been transferred, but he perceives it as transferred …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.32: If it has not been given away, but he perceives it as given away …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.33: If it has not been lost, but he perceives it as lost …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.34: If it has not been destroyed, but he perceives it as destroyed …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.35: If it has not been burnt, but he perceives it as burnt …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.36: If it has not been stolen, but he perceives it as stolen, and he keeps it beyond the robe season, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.37: If he uses a cloth which should be relinquished without first relinquishing it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.38: If it is not haste-cloth, but he perceives it as haste-cloth, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.39: If it is not haste-cloth, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.40: If it is not haste-cloth and he does not perceive it as haste-cloth, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.42: if within the robe season the haste-cloth is determined, transferred, given away, lost, destroyed, burnt, stolen, or taken on trust;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.44: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np28:2.45: The eighth rule, the training rule on haste-cloth, is finished.
